quest.name: Energy for All
journal:
 Quest Sync
Rimelnaud has precisely one solution in mind, which is notably better than zero.

Rimelnaud proposes that to circumvent the issue of needing an identification key, he and Appius reconfigure the rig's control mechanisms to operate without one. He returns to camp to gather the equipment and men needed to do so while Appius gets to work on the necessary rewiring. Meanwhile, you are tasked with slaying any particularly fearsome creatures in the vicinity, that the engineers not be accosted.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level.
You summarily execute two nearby monsters, which seems good enough. It is, after all, freezing out here.

When you return to Appius, it transpires that he has finished his preparations─and rather enjoyed watching your battle from afar. Rimelnaud then returns with the necessary power sources, which members of the contingent attach to the facility. Soon enough, Juturna Platform G roars back to life with Appius at the helm.
With the rig now confirmed operational, Rimelnaud suggests the three of you head back to camp to inform Esdelot of your roaring success.

Esdelot is delighted to hear of your achievements, and extends his gratitude for all you have done, as do the others. Thanks to you, Appius and Rimelnaud now dare to dream of the ways in which the newly recovered ceruleum supply will help the region and its people on their road to recovery.
objectives: Lie in wait at the designated location and slay any enemies that appear.
Speak with Esdelot at Camp Broken Glass.

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: I appreciate your optimism, but...how are we going to solve this problem?

dialogue.name: RIMELNAUD
dialogue.text: Is there really no way to bypass the mechanism that the identification key interacts with?

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: What exactly do you mean?

dialogue.name: RIMELNAUD
dialogue.text: I work at the manufactory in Ishgard. I once watched my superior─as is his way─dismantle a magitek armament and put it back together again.

dialogue.name: RIMELNAUD
dialogue.text: He succeeded in bypassing the verification mechanism required to activate the machine by rewiring it. I was wondering if something similar wouldn't be possible with the platform.

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: That's something a second-rate thief would do!

dialogue.name: RIMELNAUD
dialogue.text: Well, beggars can't be choosers. Save your chief engineer appearing out of thin air, it's likely our only option.

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: You've got a point there...

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: And far be it from me to turn down a proposal from an esteemed colleague! I'm so glad to have you at my disposal...

dialogue.name: RIMELNAUD
dialogue.text: Er...that's the spirit, I suppose.

dialogue.name: RIMELNAUD
dialogue.text: I shall return to camp to inform the quartermaster of our plan. He should be willing to spare an external power source and a few other tools if I vow to return them soon. Perhaps even some extra pairs of hands...

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: That leaves me to open up the control panel and rearrange a few things before Rimelnaud returns!

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: In the meantime, I'd thank you to keep an eye out for anything that might eat him on the way back.

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: There were never so many beasts around before, but they must've gotten comfortable without us traipsing back and forth across the ice─a little too comfortable, if you ask me.

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: I've done all I can for now. I even caught the end of your battle with those creatures! Spectacular.

dialogue.name: RIMELNAUD
dialogue.text: Ready to get to work, I hope?

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: Of course! All that's left is to engage in a bit of Ishgardian skullduggery.

dialogue.name: RIMELNAUD
dialogue.text: ...I'm not sure I care for that turn of phrase, but very well. We'll attach the power devices, which should allow you to utilize the control panel.

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: Thrilling!

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: This place will be up and running before you know it. Just stand back and watch the master at work.

dialogue.name: RIMELNAUD
dialogue.text: It worked...yes?

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: You bet it did! There's life in the old girl yet.

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: Of course, there's still a lot of work to be done to get it ready to extract and refine ceruleum, but we're off to an excellent start.

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: Which means Garlemald just took its first steps on the road to recovery.

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: I cannot thank you both enough!

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: I'll be feeling that thrill for days! Fortunate am I to have such brilliant new friends.

dialogue.name: RIMELNAUD
dialogue.text: I'm pleased that this plan was a success after all. I appreciate your seeing it through to the end.

dialogue.name: RIMELNAUD
dialogue.text: We can leave the rest to the engineers I brought with me. They're more than capable of keeping the place operational until we're prepared for the next phase.

dialogue.name: RIMELNAUD
dialogue.text: Now, let us all return to camp and inform Esdelot of our triumph.

dialogue.name: ESDELOT
dialogue.text: Ah, good to see you again. I was just wondering when I might hear how you had fared with the platform.

dialogue.name: ESDELOT
dialogue.text: ...And it seems I won't have any longer to wait. I trust your eagerness is a sign that you had some success?

dialogue.name: RIMELNAUD
dialogue.text: Yes, sir! We were able to access the platform's controls and confirm that it is operational. There are still adjustments to be made, but I imagine it won't be long until it's fully operational.

dialogue.name: ESDELOT
dialogue.text: Splendid. If the camp can secure a stable supply of energy, we can begin rebuilding throughout the region.

dialogue.name: ESDELOT
dialogue.text: It will doubtless give succor to those in Tapper's Den and the capital proper as well.

dialogue.name: ESDELOT
dialogue.text: One of our goals when we first came here was to improve the lives of those that still call this frozen land home, and you have made a great contribution toward realizing that ambition.

dialogue.name: RIMELNAUD
dialogue.text: Thank you, sir.

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: I certainly wouldn't have made it this far without your genius.

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: The days when Garlemald looked toward a bright future seem so distant now that the snow and frost have reclaimed their dominion...

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: But I, for one, am ready to embark on the same journey that my ancestors once did, and build a new home around the warmth of cerulean flame.

dialogue.name: RIMELNAUD
dialogue.text: I am certain that when the time comes, I shall be proud to know that I worked alongside you.

dialogue.name: RIMELNAUD
dialogue.text: I must thank you as well. You have taught me to listen with sincerity to the words of those who I would otherwise have unjustly scorned.

dialogue.name: RIMELNAUD
dialogue.text: I imagine it will be some time before we can return Laterum to its former inhabitants, but I promise that when we do, it will be in a better state than when you left.

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: Well, then, we'd better get to work!

dialogue.name: RIMELNAUD
dialogue.text: ...Ah. “We.” Indeed.
